intro: Polygala michoacana, commonly known as the Michoacan milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, delicate flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers are usually pale pink or white, and it produces small, bean-like fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
